title: Chemistry Education Achievement Improvement and Dropout Reduction Program Using Cognitive Load Theory-Based Interactive Tools

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited technological environments, emphasizing real-case-based content tailored to working professionals' applicability to job tasks.

learning_goals: Learners can improve academic achievement by over 5% by utilizing interactive tools linking chemical concepts to real-life applications with over 80% frequency
Learners can reduce cognitive load and achieve over 70% core concept comprehension by using quiz/puzzle-formatted interactive materials at least twice weekly
In post-course surveys, learners will rate the usefulness of interactive tools at 4 points or higher (5-point scale) and reduce dropout rates by 50% compared to baseline

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
